oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: General Jackson's Headquarters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of the building on Royal Street in New Orleans, Louisiana, used by Andrew Jackson as headquarters during the campaign against the British in the War of 1812.

General Andrew Jackson came to New Orleans in early December 1814 to stave off the impending attack on New Orleans by British forces during the War of 1812. The building at 106 Royal Street served as Jackson's headquarters during his stay in the city.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; United States -- History -- War of 1812
Buildings; Houses
